page.title: 03COIT PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The school was built in 1971 and was opened in 1972.It was built by West Riding of Yorkshire Authority but was taken over by Sheffield in 1972.The school is called Coit because there used to be a Coit lane going from Chapeltown to Ecclesfield.The name Coit came from the goit leading to the mill in Ecclesfield.The school is made of lightly coloured stone and round the cladding it is painted white.It has got 12 class rooms and 13 teachers including part time staff and the headteacher.The school is of anopen plan design with the hall in the middle.The school is situated just on the edges of Chapeltown.The population of the children is 299.The school has got two playgrounds and a large field where you can play rounders,cricket and football.
